sub_topic: Finding the perimeter of a rectangle.
message_1: A rectangle has a length of 10 cm and a width of 5 cm. What is the perimeter of the rectangle?
message_2:
To find the perimeter of a rectangle, you can use the formula P = 2(L + W), where P is the perimeter, L is the length, and W is the width.

In this case, the length (L) is 10 cm and the width (W) is 5 cm. Plugging these values into the formula, we get:

P = 2(10 + 5)
P = 2(15)
P = 30 cm

The perimeter of the rectangle is 30 cm.
